Posts.Content: On 5/22/2009 John123 wrote:   On 3/7/2006 Annie4 wrote: I too had side effects on taxatere. After two treatments both my hands and feet turned a dark red/purple color and then the skin began to peel of off them. The dr. put on 75% for the 3rd treatment. It got so bad that I could not walk or use my hands. They did not give me the final treatment as by that time I would have refused it. I had no more chemo after that. I just moved on the the radiation. I had stage IIB with 1 positive lymph node. How long did it take to clear up.   My wife finished her taxotere (February 23, 2009) and her feet are still red and swollen.  Her feet and back are so painful she is having to take stong narcotics and that does not take away all the pain.  She only had 3 rounds of taxotere and cytoxan and they had to stop.  She is now on oxygen and has to use a walker.  She is only 47.  They just did a double mastectomy Wednesday May 13th.  I am hoping that this clears up soon.  She was breathing and walking fine before chemotherapy.  She handled the first one okay but the second and third rounds really hurt her.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Taxotere

Posts.Content: On 3/7/2006 Annie4 wrote: I too had side effects on taxatere. After two treatments both my hands and feet turned a dark red/purple color and then the skin began to peel of off them. The dr. put on 75% for the 3rd treatment. It got so bad that I could not walk or use my hands. They did not give me the final treatment as by that time I would have refused it. I had no more chemo after that. I just moved on the the radiation. I had stage IIB with 1 positive lymph node. How long did it take to clear up.   My wife finished her taxotere (February 23, 2009) and her feet are still red and swollen.  Her feet and back are so painful she is having to take stong narcotics and that does not take away all the pain.  She only had 3 rounds of taxotere and cytoxan and they had to stop.  She is not on oxygen and has to use a walker.  She is only 47.  They just did a double mastectomy Wednesday May 13th.  I am hoping that this clears up soon.  She was breathing and walking fine before chemotherapy.  She handled the first one okay but the second and third rounds really hurt her.
